summary: Federal agencies often use consultants to conduct their work. But when the Defense Department and other agencies with sensitive missions contract with consultants also working for potential U.S. adversaries such as China, it can pose risks to national security. Existing regulations and policies don't specifically address consultant contracting activity with China prior to awarding most contracts. title: Federal Contracting: Timely Actions Needed to Address Risks Posed by Consultants Working for China
